post.description:
To programmatically search a user account in the ThoughtSpot system use this API endpoint.
Using this API, you can search a user with GUID / name.

user_identifier.description: GUID / name of the user to be updated

display_name.description: A unique display name string for the user account, usually their first and last name

user_group_identifiers.description: List of user-group to be associated with

privileges.description: List of privileges to be associated with

account_status.description: Current status of the user account.

notify_on_share.description: User preference for receiving email notifications when another ThoughtSpot user shares answers or pinboards.

show_onboarding_experience.description: The user preference for revisiting the onboarding experience.

onboarding_experience_completed.description: flag to get the on-boarding experience is completed or not.

org_identifiers.description: List of Unique Organization Identifiers to be associated with

post.description: To programmatically search an Organization in the ThoughtSpot system use this API endpoint.

org_identifier.description: identifier for the Organization: Either unique id or unique name of the Organization.

user_identifier.description: User identifier for the Organization: Either unique id or unique name of the user.

post.description:
To programmatically search tags in the ThoughtSpot system use this API endpoint.
Provide any of tag attributes. Matching tags will be returned.

tag_identifier.description: Name or Id of the tag.

post.description: Search User Groups from the current organization

default_liveboard_identifiers.description: Unique ID of liveboards which will be assigned as default liveboards to the user group.

display_name.description: Unique display name for the user group.

group_identifier.description: Unique ID or name of the user group.

org_identifiers.description: Unique ID or name of the organization where the user group will be created. If not specified then group will be created in the current logged in organization. Note that only tenant admins are allowed to create group across organization.

privileges.description: Privileges which will be assigned to the user group.

sub_group_identifiers.description: Unique ID or name of the User Groups who will be part of the user group.

user_identifiers.description: Unique ID or name of the Users who will be part of the user group.

visibility.description: Visibility of the user group. The SHARABLE makes a user group visible to other users and user groups, and thus allows them to share objects.

visualization_identifiers.description: List of unique ID or name of visualizations.

record_offset.description: The starting record number from where the records should be included.

record_size.description: The number of records that should be included.

runtime_filter.description: JSON object representing filter condition to filter the data.

runtime_sort.description: JSON object representing columns to sort the data.

post.description: Fetch permissions of principals (Users or Usergroups).

metadata.description:
Metadata objects considered while fetching permission of specified principals.
If not provided then all applicable metadata objects are considered.

post.description: Fetch permissions on metadata objects.

principals.description:
Principal details considered while fetching permission on metadata objects.
If not provided then all applicable principals are considered.

include_dependent_objects.description: Indicates whether to fetch permissions of depedent metadata objects.

end_epoc_time_in_millis.description: End epoc time in milli seconds.

start_epoc_time_in_millis.description: Start epoc time in milli seconds.

post.description:
You can programmatically create login session for a user in ThoughtSpot using this endpoint. 

You can create session by either providing userName and password as inputs in this request body or by including "Authorization" header with the token generated through the endpoint /tspublic/rest/v2/session/gettoken. 

userName and password input is given precedence over "Authorization" header, when both are included in the request.

password.description: The password of the user account

remember_me.description: A flag to remember the user session. When set to true, sets a session cookie that persists in subsequent API calls.

post.description:
To programmatically create session token for a user in ThoughtSpot, use this endpoint. 

You can generate the token for a user by providing password or secret key from the cluster. 

You need to enable trusted authentication to generate secret key. To generate secret key, follow below steps. 


 1. Click the Develop tab. 


 2. Under Customizations, click Settings. 


 3. To enable trusted authentication, turn on the toggle. 


 4. A secret_key for trusted authentication is generated. 


 5. Click the clipboard icon to copy the token. 


 

Password is given precedence over secretKey input, when both are included in the request.

password.description: The password of the user account

secret_key.description: The secret key string provided by the ThoughtSpot application server. ThoughtSpot generates this secret key when you enable trusted authentication.

object_id.description: GUID of the ThoughtSpot object. If set, the bearer will only have access to the specified Liveboard or another object.

validity_time_in_sec.description: Duration in seconds after which the token expires

organization_id.description: Id of the organization to be associated with the user login. If no input is provided then last logged in organization will be considered

auto_create.description: user_options attribute is added as an optional attribute which will allow JIT token support

post.description:
To programmatically create session token for a user in ThoughtSpot, use this endpoint. 

You can generate the token for a user by providing password or secret key from the cluster. 

You need to enable trusted authentication to generate secret key. To generate secret key, follow below steps. 


 1. Click the Develop tab. 


 2. Under Customizations, click Settings. 


 3. To enable trusted authentication, turn on the toggle. 


 4. A secret_key for trusted authentication is generated. 


 5. Click the clipboard icon to copy the token. 


 

Password is given precedence over secretKey input, when both are included in the request.

password.description: The password of the user account

secret_key.description: The secret key string provided by the ThoughtSpot application server. ThoughtSpot generates this secret key when you enable trusted authentication.

validity_time_in_sec.description: Duration in seconds after which the token expires

organization_id.description: Id of the organization to be associated with the user login. If no input is provided then last logged in organization will be considered

auto_create.description: user_options attribute is added as an optional attribute which will allow JIT token support

post.description: To log a user out of the current session, use this endpoint
To expire or revoke a token for a user, use this endpoint

To programmatically create a user account in the ThoughtSpot system use this API endpoint. Using this API, you can create a user and assign groups.
To create a user, you require admin user privileges.

name.description: Name of the user. The username string must be unique.

display_name.description: A unique display name string for the user account, usually their first and last name

account_status.description: Current status of the user account.

org_identifiers.description: List of Unique Organization Identifiers to be associated with

user_group_identifiers.description: List of user-group to be associated with

visibility.description: Visibility of the user. The visibility attribute is set to DEFAULT when creating a user. The DEFAULT attribute makes a user visible to other users and user groups, and this allows them to share objects

notify_on_share.description: User preference for receiving email notifications when another ThoughtSpot user shares answers or pinboards.

show_onboarding_experience.description: The user preference for revisiting the onboarding experience.

onboarding_experience_completed.description: flag to get the on-boarding experience is completed or not.

home_liveboard_identifier.description: to set GUID for home live board.

favorite_metadatas.description: to set GUID for home live board.

post.description:
To programmatically delete a user account in the ThoughtSpot system use this API endpoint.
Using this API, you can delete by passing GUID / name of the user.
To delete a user, you require admin user privileges.

user_identifier.description: GUID / name of the user to be deleted

post.description:
To programmatically update a user account in the ThoughtSpot system use this API endpoint.
Using this API, you can update a user and assign groups.
To update a user, you require admin user privileges.

user_identifier.description: GUID / name of the user to be updated

name.description: Name of the user. The username string must be unique.

display_name.description: A unique display name string for the user account, usually their first and last name

visibility.description: Visibility of the user. The visibility attribute is set to DEFAULT when creating a user. The DEFAULT attribute makes a user visible to other users and user groups, and this allows them to share objects

account_status.description: Current status of the user account.

notify_on_share.description: User preference for receiving email notifications when another ThoughtSpot user shares answers or pinboards.

show_onboarding_experience.description: The user preference for revisiting the onboarding experience.

onboarding_experience_completed.description: flag to get the on-boarding experience is completed or not.

user_group_identifiers.description: List of user-group to be associated with

home_liveboard_identifier.description: to set GUID for home live board.

favorite_metadatas.description: to set GUID for home live board.

org_identifiers.description: List of Unique Organization Identifiers to be associated with

post.description:
To programmatically import users accounts in the ThoughtSpot system use this API endpoint.
Using this API, you can import multiple users.

users.description: List of users needs to be imported.

default_password.description: Default password to be set if password field not present in above import user like first one

dry_run.description: If true, This will preview the impacted users, but changes won't applied into the system

delete_unspecified_users.description: if true, this api will delete all other users specified in above users list. Some important users like tsadmin, guest, system and su will be ignored.

user_identifier.description: Unique ID or name of the user.

user_identifier.description: Unique ID or name of the user.

post.description: To programmatically create an org in the ThoughtSpot system use this API endpoint.

color.description: Hex color code to be assigned to the tag.Example, Input: #ff78a9.

post.description: To programmatically update tags, use this endpoint. Specify either tag id or tag name

tag_identifier.description: Name or Id of the tag.

color.description: Hex color code to be assigned to the tag.Example, Input: #ff78a9

post.description: To programmatically delete tags, use this endpoint. Specify either tag id or tag name

tag_identifier.description: Tag identifier Tag name or Tag id.

post.description: Assign tags to metadata objects in the ThoughtSpot system

metadata_type.description:
Types of metadata object(s): ANSWER, LIVEBOARD, LOGICAL_TABLE, LOGICAL_COLUMN
Example: ['ANSWER', 'LIVEBOARD']

metadata_identifiers.description:
Metadata identifier(s) for the given metadata types.
Example: ['MetadataGUID1-or-MetadataName1', 'MetadataGUID2-or-MetadataName2']
Note: metadata_identifiers[i] corresponds to metadata_type[i]

post.description: Unassign tags to metadata objects in the ThoughtSpot system

metadata_type.description:
Types of metadata object(s): ANSWER, LIVEBOARD, LOGICAL_TABLE, LOGICAL_COLUMN
Example: ['ANSWER', 'LIVEBOARD']

metadata_identifiers.description:
Metadata identifier(s) for the given metadata types.
Example: ['MetadataGUID1-or-MetadataName1', 'MetadataGUID2-or-MetadataName2']
Note: metadata_identifiers[i] corresponds to metadata_type[i]

user_identifiers.description: Unique ID or name of the Users who will be part of the user group.

Visibility of the user group. The SHARABLE makes a user group visible to other users and user groups, and thus 
allows them to share objects.
